context:
List of European Conservatives and Reformists Members of the European Parliament
Name | Country | Constituency | Party | Born | Notes
--- | --- | --- | --- | --- | ---
Tadeusz Cymański | Poland | Pomeranian | Law and Justice | 6 June 1955 Nowy Staw | ECR member 2009-11 . MEP 2009-14 . Joined United Poland and EFD on 26 December 2011
Roger Helmer | United Kingdom | East Midlands | Conservative Party | 25 January 1944 London | ECR member 2009-12 . MEP 1999- . Joined UKIP and EFD on 2 March 2012
Jacek Kurski | Poland | Podlaskie and Warmian-Masurian | Law and Justice | 22 February 1966 Gdańsk | ECR member 2009-11 . MEP 2009-14 . Joined United Poland and EFD on 26 December 2011
Zbigniew Ziobro | Poland | Lesser Poland and Świętokrzyskie | Law and Justice | 18 August 1970 Kraków | ECR member 2009-11 . MEP 2009-14 . Joined United Poland and EFD on 26 December 2011
Jacek Włosowicz | Poland | Lesser Poland and Świętokrzyskie | Law and Justice | 25 January 1966 Skalbmierz | ECR member 2009-11 . MEP 2009-14 . Joined United Poland and EFD on 26 December 2011
Edward McMillan-Scott | United Kingdom | Yorkshire and the Humber | Conservative Party | 15 August 1949 Cambridge | ECR member 2009 . MEP 1984-2014 . Left ECR on 14 July 2009 . Joined Lib Dems in 2010
Marta Andreasen | United Kingdom | South East England | Conservative Party | 26 November 1954 Buenos Aires | ECR member 2013-14 . MEP 2009-14 . Elected for UKIP . Joined 22 February 2013 . Failed to get re-elected
Robert Atkins | United Kingdom | North West England | Conservative Party | 5 February 1946 London | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 1999-2014 . Did not stand for re-election
Adam Bielan | Poland | Masovian | Poland Together | 12 September 1974 Gdańsk | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 2004-14 . Elected for PiS , joined PJN in 2010 , then Poland Together in 2013 . Failed to get re-elected
Lajos Bokros | Hungary | Hungary | Modern Hungary Movement | 26 June 1954 Budapest | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 2009-14 . Elected for the Hungarian Democratic Forum , founded MoMa on 21 April 2013 . Did not stand for re-election
Philip Bradbourn | United Kingdom | West Midlands | Conservative Party | 9 August 1951 Tipton | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 2009-14 . Died 19 December 2014
Milan Cabrnoch | Czech Republic | Czech Republic | Civic Democratic Party | 6 August 1962 Čáslav | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 2004-14 . Did not stand for re-election
Martin Callanan | United Kingdom | North East England | Conservative Party | 8 August 1961 Newcastle | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 1999-2014 . ECR Chairman 2011-14 . Failed to get re-elected
Andrea Češková | Czech Republic | Czech Republic | Civic Democratic Party | 18 October 1971 Prague | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 2009-14 . Did not stand for re-election
Giles Chichester | United Kingdom | South West England | Conservative Party | 29 July 1946 London | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 1999-14 . Did not stand for re-election
Susy De Martini | Italy | North-West Italy | The Right | 17 June 1952 Genoa | ECR member 2013-14 . MEP 2013-14 . Elected for The People of Freedom . Became an MEP in February 2013 . Joined ECR in March 2013 . Failed to get re-elected
James Elles | United Kingdom | South East England | Conservative Party | 3 September 1949 London | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 1984-2014 . Did not stand for re-election
Derk Jan Eppink | Belgium | Dutch-speaking | Libertarian , Direct , Democratic | 7 November 1958 Steenderen | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 2009-14 . Vice-Chairman . Belgian delegation leader . Did not stand for re-election
Hynek Fajmon | Czech Republic | Czech Republic | Civic Democratic Party | 17 May 1968 Nymburk | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 2004-14 . ECR Co-Treasurer . Did not stand for re-election
Malcolm Harbour | United Kingdom | West Midlands | Conservative Party | 19 February 1947 Woking | ECR member 2009-14 . MEP 1999-2014 . Did not stand for re-election

wiki_section_title: Former members

wiki_section_text: 

intro: This is a list of European Conservatives and Reformists Members of the European Parliament. The European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) was founded in June 2009, and currently has 62 members in the European Parliament.

qa.question: Which party did the former member of European Conservatives and Reformists Members of the European Parliament from the capital and largest city in the Czech Republic represent ?

nq_190406_31.Query Analysis: The query asks which party a former member of the European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) Members of the European Parliament (MEP) from Prague, the capital and largest city in the Czech Republic, represented.
nq_190406_31.Query Keywords Extraction: former member, European Conservatives and Reformists, Members of the European Parliament, capital, largest city, Czech Republic, represent, party
nq_190406_31.Answer Analysis: The answer is the Civic Democratic Party, indicating that the former ECR MEP from Prague represented this party.
nq_190406_31.Document Content Analysis: The document lists members of the European Parliament from the Czech Republic, organized by their respective parties and the parliamentary groups they belong to. It includes members from the Christian and Democratic Union - Czechoslovak People's Party (EPP Group) and the Civic Democratic Party (ECR Group).
nq_190406_31.Document and Query Keywords Matching: The document mentions 'Civic Democratic Party' and 'European Conservatives and Reformists', which are key terms from the query.
nq_190406_31.Document and Answer Keywords Matching: The document explicitly mentions the 'Civic Democratic Party', which is the answer to the query.
nq_190406_31.Key Information Matching: The document provides a list of MEPs from the Czech Republic, including those from the Civic Democratic Party, which is part of the ECR Group. This matches the key information needed to answer the query.
nq_190406_31.Can the Document Answer the Query: Yes, the document directly mentions the Civic Democratic Party as part of the ECR Group, which answers the query.
nq_190406_31.Can the Document Help Infer Additional I: Yes, the document provides context about the political affiliations of MEPs from the Czech Republic, which helps in understanding the political landscape.
nq_190406_31.Explanation: The document is directly relevant to the query as it provides the specific information needed to answer it, namely the party affiliation of a former ECR MEP from Prague. The mention of the Civic Democratic Party within the context of the ECR Group directly addresses the query.

ott_40735_2.Query Analysis: The query seeks to identify the political party represented by a former member of the European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) Members of the European Parliament (MEP) who is from the capital and largest city in the Czech Republic.
ott_40735_2.Query Keywords Extraction: former member, European Conservatives and Reformists, MEP, capital, largest city, Czech Republic, represent, party
ott_40735_2.Answer Analysis: The answer specifies that the former member represented the Civic Democratic Party.
ott_40735_2.Document Content Analysis: The document lists former members of the European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) in the European Parliament, including their names, countries, regions, political parties, birthdates, and cities. It specifically mentions two members from the Czech Republic, Andrea Češková and Hynek Fajmon, both associated with the Civic Democratic Party.
ott_40735_2.Document and Query Keywords Matching: The document includes keywords such as 'ECR member', 'Czech Republic', and 'Civic Democratic Party'.
ott_40735_2.Document and Answer Keywords Matching: The document mentions 'Civic Democratic Party', which is the answer to the query.
ott_40735_2.Key Information Matching: The document provides information about former ECR members from the Czech Republic, including their political party affiliations. It specifically mentions Andrea Češková from Prague, the capital and largest city in the Czech Republic, and her affiliation with the Civic Democratic Party.
ott_40735_2.Can the Document Answer the Query: Yes, the document directly answers the query by identifying Andrea Češková as a former ECR member from Prague who represented the Civic Democratic Party.
ott_40735_2.Can the Document Help Infer Additional I: Yes, the document provides additional context about other former ECR members and their affiliations, which can help in understanding the political landscape.
ott_40735_2.Explanation: The document is directly relevant to the query as it provides the specific information needed to answer it. It identifies a former ECR member from Prague and specifies the party they represented, which matches the query's requirements.
